message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which disrupts transcription in bacterial cells. This is useful in treating tuberculosis, as it prevents the bacteria from replicating and spreading.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which disrupts transcription in bacteria including M. tuberculosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which disrupts transcription in bacteria such as M. tuberculosis. This is one of the mechanisms by which rifampin is effective in treating TB infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which is needed for transcription of RNA from DNA. This disruption of the transcription process helps target bacterial infections, such as tuberculosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which is needed for transcription. Inhibition of this process disrupts bacterial protein synthesis and leads to cell death, making it an effective treatment for tuberculosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to the beta-subunit of DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which disrupts transcription in bacteria including Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which is required for transcription in bacteria. So, the bacterial RNA polymerase will be inhibited, which will disrupt transcription and ultimately help in the treatment of TB.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin is an antibiotic that targets bacterial DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, inhibiting transcription in the bacteria. It is one of the first-line agents used to treat tuberculosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin is an antibiotic that acts by inhibiting DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which is a key enzyme involved in transcription in bacteria. Since tuberculosis is caused by a bacterium, inhibition of RNA polymerase will disrupt the bacterial transcription process and thereby help to kill the bacteria.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Rifampin inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which is necessary for transcription to occur. By inhibiting this enzyme, rifampin disrupts the process of transcribing RNA from DNA, which is necessary for the survival of M. tuberculosis.
